website_summaries.verdict: A quality machine that efficiently binds thick letter-size books.
pros: Doesn’t take much effort to operate
The design allows you to punch pages while it’s binding previously punched ones to save time
Binds books of up to 300 sheets
cons: Paper size limited to 8.5 by 11 inches

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after very little use
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this binding machine. I have only used it about 15 times and it has stopped working. However, I am outside of the return window. It will no longer open the combs. When there are no comes the metal teeth will open all the way but when it hits tension when a comb is loaded it will not open. I loved this machine when it worked but now I am out $50+!
customer_reviews.author: CMM

customer_reviews.title: It's great, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I bound over 150 books with this binder for school! It's great, lightweight, and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Lazypuppergaming

customer_reviews.title: Costly But Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model for years. I bought a cheaper binding machine and it worked once and broke which really sucked so decided to spend the extra money for this brand. It is easy to use, holds several size combs, made well and doesn't take the space that some of the cheaper ones do. Yes it still is bulky but half the size .
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ceballos

customer_reviews.title: too expensive
customer_reviews.text: super simple, only makes holes, few pages at the time, it is hard to predict where the hole will start. I would give 1 star but I believe myself is big part of the issue: I am assuming I dont know how to use this, that is why three starts. But I can not be blind to notice this was over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Mpu

customer_reviews.title: machine works great
customer_reviews.text: After a few tries we we finally figured out the correct way to put in the combs - so that they open from the bottom. We have made 15 booklets of 90 pages each with no problems. For us, the best number of 20lb pages to punch was 10 or less because it took less force. Also, it seems that 90 pages plus clear cover and back was really the practical maximum load for the 5/8 inch comb.
customer_reviews.author: northstate dweller

customer_reviews.title: Great for Homeschoolers
customer_reviews.text: I'm homeschooling this year and have a ton of ebooks. Finally decided to buy one of these, and I'm so happy with it. It's easy to use. Since it's still fairly new, I can't speak to it's durability, but it's easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: AliseMat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and a game changer for this teacher
customer_reviews.text: OMG. Where has this been the last 15 years of my teaching career? No more spending money on binders for my visuals and books that I make. Sometimes I’d get frustrated when I didn’t line the papers up and ruin the plastic cover but otherwise it’s amazing. I used a GF to help pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: Must have for teachers
customer_reviews.text: I love this binder! I have to bind nearly 100 student workbooks every summer for my Earth Sciences classes. It's held up well to all the work I've used it for. I do wish it could punch more pages at a time but regardless, it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: MLW

customer_reviews.title: Makes binding a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: Love my Fellowes Binding Machine. It makes binding a breeze. While I wish it was made a little sturdier so far it has worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Bahmer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Can punch holes in about 12 pages at a time so patience for the punching but excellent binding
customer_reviews.author: Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: It's my second time using it and the machine won't open the combs. If there is no comb it works but with one it does not. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: butterflies55

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little practice to perfect the process but it works great once you do.
customer_reviews.author: Melwick8

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This simple little machine is so handy to have in my classroom!!
customer_reviews.author: Peppy1195

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, hard to mess up.
customer_reviews.text: Great binding machine for the cost. The ability to line things up on the edge to make everything neat is a great feature. It does exactly what I need it to do. Even though you can only do 12 sheets at a time, I'm able to bind a good size book quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Perrines

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and satisfies my binding needs.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen S

customer_reviews.title: love it - works well
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the first time today - love it
customer_reviews.author: wealthymom

customer_reviews.title: Ok for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: This binding machine is probably good for occasional use but I purchased for a teacher workshop. It did not punch all the way through the paper if you loaded more than a couple of sheets. I was afraid that the handle would break if pressed too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: We returned this once for an exchange and now the 2nd one is now broke also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home or small office
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see a spiral binding machine at such a reasonable price. It's perfect for home use or small office. The instructions are easy to understand and the machine works perfectly. I'm using the Fellowes presentation covers (52124). and the 1/4 inch plastic combs (52366). I prefer the clear front covers. You shouldn't expect the machine to come with all supplies. The back and front covers are easy to punch individually. The machine uses up to 5/8 inch combs which will hold 120 pages. This makes a very professional looking product. I'm sure for a H.S. student and nursing student this machine will get a work-out for essays etc.
customer_reviews.author: xkydivr

customer_reviews.title: Fellowes Gets It
customer_reviews.text: I've used several different brands of binding machines over the decades. In my experience, and this model is another example, Fellowes truly gets how we use binding machines for home and small batch production. This machine is very easy to use and it works perfectly. The ouch can only handle about ten pages at a time, but you can actually bind 120 pages at a time, they aren't exaggerating that claim. For the money, this is a fantastic binding option. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: S. Templar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use binding machine
customer_reviews.text: This binding machine works great for creating books and binding pamphlets together. My kids have enjoyed using it to make books this summer. You can't go wrong with Fellowes, they are a quality office brand. I do wish it came with some sample binding clips so I could have started out of the box. Had to make a trip to the office store to buy some.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bird

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised and the price is good.  If you have large jobs, this might not be the best tool for you, though.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, although I'd prefer it to be able to cut more than 12 sheets at a time. The price is right, though, so it makes it worth the savings if you have to repeat the process in order to get all of your sheets, but if you're binding a bunch of books, it could get tedious. I had my engineer-son-in-law, who has experience with these types of machines in his engineering and design businesses, do a review on video for your viewing pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Not a new machine
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that I paid for a new machine and this one is obviously has been used. The box was torn, the plastic that covers the machine was ripped. and the booklet was out of the zipped bag. Appears to be okay, but haven't decided to keep it just yet. I did punch 10 sheets of paper and it seemed to work as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Helpful office tool
customer_reviews.text: Straightforward, easy to use, good for smallish projects. Would have been nice if it came with a few combs, for the price. Overall not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Nero Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This binder works great. The instructions are clear and easy to follow. The end result is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B.

product_meta.title: Fellowes Binding Machine Starlet2+ Comb Binding (5227701),White
product_meta.description: The Fellowes Starlet2+ Comb Binding Machine is an easy-to-use, light duty comb binding machine for personal use. Manually punches up to 12 sheets at a time and binds up to 120 sheets with a 5/8” comb. Adjustable edge guide centers documents with ease. Document thickness / comb guide helps user select proper comb width.
feature_bullets: Manually punches up to 12 sheets of paper at a time
Binds up to 120 sheets with a 5/8" comb
Enhanced accuracy edge guide centers documents with ease for pinpoint punching
Built-in comb storage tray with integrated document measurement device for added convenience and quick set-up

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars93 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
